nodes.bodyText:
Not related to your changes..
shall we replace the for-loop inside stringToRefType with a switch case?
how about something like processDocumentationCodeContent to be consistent with the naming conventions?
should we check for TAB also?

Is it possible to merge this section with the lookAheadForDocumentationReference method?
i.e:  lookAheadForDocumentationReference will process all the tokens and returns the token, instead of the lookahead count
Can we handle this without throwing an exception?
what if we send a 'return' keyword token from the lexer?

Can you explain whats happening in tis snippet?
I think you'l have to consider windows environments as well, since in windows, theres a carriage return (\r) for newlines.

To get the full text containing in the NodeList<Node> docElements. I loop through it and append all docElement.toString()s. In the last docElement there will be a \n in its last children's trailing minutiae which should not be included in the documentation line text.
yeah few parser tests too are falling in windows build. That's should be due  to above reason. I'll fix
I think the issue is using element.toString(). That can cause issues  since toString() includes minutiae such as newlines, invalid tokens etc. We should use .text() method in the Token class

We will have a problem for lines having documentation reference. e.g  text of annotation `field a` documentation will be annotation`field a`documentation   if we use .text(), as white spaces there are captured as trivia. Shall I use toString() anyway? and replace \r\n and  \n with "" at the end

ah ok. +1.
But please make sure it won't include other minutiae such as invalid nodes, comments, etc.

Shall we use the constant LexerTerminals.RETURN.
BTW, usually we swap the arguments as a practice to make the .equals() is called on the constant..
eg: "return".equals(getLexeme()) or LexerTerminals.RETURN.equals(getLexeme())
That way we can avoid any possible NPE.  i.e: even if getLexeme() returns a null, it will not throw a NPE
